channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 拜登总统的国情咨文涉及经济、乌克兰、堕胎保护和捍卫民主等问题。#SOTU2024
item.description:
President Biden's State of the Union address covered the economy, Ukraine, abortion protections and defending democracy, among other issues.

Read the full text here. #SOTU2024 https://t.co/kbrg7nw0Hm https://t.co/kbrg7nw0Hm

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 拜登总统在国情咨文演说中表示，美国军方将在加沙海岸设置一个临时码头，供货船卸载食品、水和其他紧急物资 #SOTU2024
item.description:
At the State of the Union address, President Biden said that the U.S. military will install a temporary pier off the Gaza coast for cargo ships to unload food, water and other emergency supplies #SOTU2024 https://t.co/ZFdEGnOVaR https://t.co/ZFdEGnOVaR

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 拜登总统在国情咨文演讲中表示，美国正在 "夜以继日 "地努力将在俄罗斯被监禁近一年的《华尔街日报》记者埃文-格什科维奇（Evan Gershkovich）带回家#SOTU2024
item.description:
At the State of the Union address, President Biden said the U.S. is working "around the clock" to bring home Evan Gershkovich, the Wall Street Journal reporter who has been imprisoned in Russia for nearly a year #SOTU2024 https://t.co/YO92sQASBv https://t.co/YO92sQASBv

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 在国情咨文演讲中，拜登总统强调了他在大麻问题上所做的努力，这对年轻选民来说是一个潜在的棘手问题。他说："任何人都不应该因为使用或拥有大麻而被监禁。#SOTU2024
item.description:
At the State of the Union address, President Biden touted his efforts on marijuana, a potentially potent issue for young voters.

“No one should be jailed for using or possessing marijuana,” he said. #SOTU2024 https://t.co/u531Tnznlw https://t.co/u531Tnznlw

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：也许理智开始在加州占上风。在周二的初选中，选民支持在犯罪和其他生活质量问题上进行政策修正，这让人们看到了希望的曙光。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Perhaps sanity is starting to prevail in California. There are glimmers of hope after voters backed a policy course correction on crime and other quality-of-life issues in Tuesday’s primary. https://t.co/pagke0YqF3 https://t.co/pagke0YqF3

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 在国情咨文演讲中，拜登总统抨击共和党人放弃了上个月破裂的两党边境协议--当共和党人对他报以嘘声时，拜登总统进行了回击 #SOTU2024
item.description:
At the State of the Union address, President Biden slammed Republicans for walking away from a bipartisan border deal that collapsed last month—and shot back when Republicans booed him #SOTU2024 https://t.co/Oj34nFHqOk https://t.co/Oj34nFHqOk

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 共和党参议员乔希-霍利（Josh Hawley）赢得了足够多的共和党同僚的支持，通过了一项向受到核试验和铀设施产生的风吹放射性微粒影响的美国人大幅扩大支付范围的法案
item.description:
Republican Sen. Josh Hawley won over enough GOP colleagues to pass a major expansion of payments to Americans exposed to windblown radioactive particles from nuclear tests and uranium facilities https://t.co/Y4hCFqzx4Q https://t.co/Y4hCFqzx4Q

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 在国情咨文演讲中，拜登总统谈到了他的经济记录，并将低失业率和通货膨胀率下降归功于他。但是，尽管经济强劲，许多美国人仍对经济持悲观态度。
item.description:
At the State of the Union address, President Biden discussed his economic record and took credit for low unemployment and falling inflation. But despite the economy's strength, many Americans feel persistently pessimistic about it. https://t.co/zVyehIEz5w https://t.co/zVyehIEz5w

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 在国情咨文演讲中，拜登总统警告最高法院的法官们，他们在堕胎和其他问题上的决定可能会引起妇女的反弹。这是对法院不同寻常的直接斥责。#SOTU2024
item.description:
At the State of the Union address, President Biden warned Supreme Court justices that their decisions on abortion and other issues could risk a backlash from women. It was an unusually direct rebuke of the court. #SOTU2024 https://t.co/GJ3fnM2dLX https://t.co/GJ3fnM2dLX

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 拜登总统呼吁国会继续支持乌克兰，使其能够抵御俄罗斯的侵略。#SOTU2024
item.description:
President Biden called upon Congress to continue supporting Ukraine so it can defend itself against Russian aggression.

"If anyone in this room thinks Putin will stop at Ukraine, I assure you he will not." #SOTU2024 https://t.co/Ck7ym8GC9s https://t.co/Ck7ym8GC9s

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 在科威德-19 大流行期间，全美的百万富翁们纷纷搬到天堂谷，并留了下来。这个位于亚利桑那州中部的小镇坐落在凤凰城和斯科茨代尔之间，拥有美国最昂贵的沙漠房地产。
item.description:
Millionaires from across the U.S. moved to Paradise Valley during the Covid-19 pandemic—and stayed. The central Arizona town, tucked between Phoenix and Scottsdale, is home to America's priciest desert real estate. https://t.co/HFjQqaLSh1 https://t.co/HFjQqaLSh1

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 这种全身训练可以让你获得所需的有氧运动和力量训练，而无需在健身房里耗费大量时间。这种循环训练是美国职业足球联盟（MLS）洛杉矶银河队在季后赛中的主要训练手段。
item.description:

item.title: 拜登总统希望在国情咨文中与唐纳德-特朗普和共和党人形成鲜明对比。观看直播并关注我们的分析。#SOTU2024

item.title: 前众议员乔治-桑托斯（George Santos）在被逐出国会仅数月后突然现身美国国会大厦，出席今晚的国情咨文 #SOTU2024

item.title: 波音公司正在全面改革其支付员工奖金的方式，以强调质量和安全而非达到财务目标，这是继阿拉斯加航空公司一架航班的舱门塞爆炸事件后，波音公司为解决质量问题而采取的众多举措之一。
item.description:
Boeing is overhauling how it pays employee bonuses to emphasize quality and safety over meeting financial targets, one of many moves to address quality issues following the door-plug blowout on an Alaska Air flight https://t.co/JVsmyYQ5g2 https://t.co/JVsmyYQ5g2

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 8, 2024

item.title: 一家位于得克萨斯州的公司可以将您亲人的火化遗体送入轨道、深空或月球。但是，将月球视为神圣之地的纳瓦霍部落正在进行反击。
item.description:
A Texas-based company can send your loved ones’ cremated remains into orbit, deep space or to the moon. But the Navajo Nation, who considers the moon sacred, is pushing back. https://t.co/nc7JLmFZba https://t.co/nc7JLmFZba

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：俄勒冈州选民决定在 2020 年容忍持有硬性毒品。立法者即将扭转这一错误，@KevinSabet 写道。

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：民主党让整个社会形成了太多的负面反馈回路。@Dan-Henninger写道：在我们的政治中，有一个人因此被贴上了标签：总统。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: The Democrats have allowed too many negative feedback loops to develop across society. There is a pervasive sense of being hurt, and in our politics one person gets tagged for that: the president, writes @DanHenninger. https://t.co/HckrvT6oo6

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024

item.title: 多年来，艺术品经销商布伦丹-杜根（Brendan Dugan）一直住在租来的公寓里，这些公寓就像他的画廊一样，简陋而乏味。后来，随着生意蒸蒸日上，一位室内设计师提高了他的设计水平。
item.description:
For years, art dealer Brendan Dugan lived in rented apartments that were a lot like his gallery: scrappy and seat-of-the-pants. Then as business took off, an interior designer raised his game. https://t.co/8ajQzu8UYp https://t.co/8ajQzu8UYp

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 7, 2024
